skillTree.name: Fuelled by Blood
skillTree.description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Voice of the Dark Gods
skillTree.description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice – a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%
Leadership: +5
Character's aura leadership effect: +5
Leadership aura size: +25%
Passive ability: "The Plague Master"

skillTree.name: Darkling Spirit
skillTree.description: Shamans do not generally engage in physical combat themselves, instead sending out their spirit to possess a suitably monstrous surrogate.

effects.description: Bound spell: "Savage Dominion"

skillTree.name: Speaker of Darkling Counsel
skillTree.description: Bray-Shamans speak the will of the Dark Gods, and those that defy them pay the highest price of all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

Winds of Magic cost: +15% for all enemy spells
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.name: Uncanny Senses
skillTree.description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 15%

skillTree.name: Shadow Hide
skillTree.description: Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.name: Dreads & Charms
skillTree.description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.

effects.description: Armour: +15
Melee defence: +5

skillTree.name: Hardened Pelts
skillTree.description: By the Bray-Shaman’s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +15 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Dual Wielder
skillTree.description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15%
Charge bonus: +15

skillTree.name: Bellows of the Discordant
skillTree.description: In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Gods’ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +15% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Repugnant Stalker
skillTree.description: Stalking across the lands of Man like a black, hobbled crow, Slugtongue turns the most fecund and fertile valleys into barren and freezing wastes crawling with poisonous vermin.

effects.description:
Increased chance of plague breaking out at the start of each turn.
	(Lord's army)
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment

skillTree.name: Whispers of Death
skillTree.description: Wherever Slugtongue goes destruction and famine follows him. Ravenous living hurricanes of skull-headed locusts whip and tear across the crop-fields, reducing them to shocking ruin in seconds. Rivers of virgin meltwater turn to bile at the sound of his gurgling, phlegm-choked laughter.

effects.description:
Slugtongue leaves "The Black Harvest" effects in enemy regions
	(effects lasts 3 turns)

Plague duration: +3 turns
	(local enemy region)

skillTree.name: Ravenous Maggots
skillTree.description: At first glance, Slugtongue could be mistaken for a death-devil, for his head is little more than a leering, bovine skull and his emaciated body is covered with liver-spots and coarse, white hair. Yet on closer inspection Slugtongue teems with life, albeit of the basest kind - he is host to colonies of fat black lice, hopping fleas, bloated tics, wriggling worms and stink-bodied cockroaches that infest every dank crevice of his wretched frame.

effects.description: Upgrades ability: "Curse of the Famine Fiend"
Attribute: Causes Fear
Attribute: Causes Terror

skillTree.name: Followers of Slugtongue
skillTree.description: Those who follow Slugtongue are ready for slaughter, knowing full well that war follows famine as surely as winter follows autumn. When the armies of the starving and frightened march to confront Slugtongue they are met by hordes of well-fed, hot-tempered and battle-ready Beastmen who descend upon them from every direction.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +15%
	(all armies factionwide)

Melee defence: +6 for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Supernatural Blight
skillTree.description: A master of Wild Magic and Shyish, Slugtongue's very presence causes his foes to begin to wither away from his supernatural blight.

effects.description: Enables "Slugtongue's Curse!" contact effect (damage over time)

Army ability: "Viletide"
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Viletide"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Viletide Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Lord of the Black Harvest
skillTree.description: As repugnant as Slugtongue is at first-hand, the signs of his passing are just as disturbing. With a single whispered phrase, he can unleash the power of blight upon the land and those that defend it.

skillTree.description: A vile wave indeed, the creeping things that nest in the decaying undergrowth swarm all over the foe.

skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman magnifies the savage and animalistic parts of the foe's psyche until they are no more than growling beasts.

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Bestial Surge
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman inflames the uncontrollable urge to rend the foe limb from limb, causing the roaring, bellowing mass to surge forward.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Bestial Surge"

skillTree.name: Mantle of Ghorok
skillTree.description: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible and dangerous to the bearer.

skillTree.name: Presence of Morrslieb
skillTree.description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

effects.description: Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.name: Fury of the Herd
skillTree.description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

skillTree.name: Beastlord’s Spite
skillTree.description: The Beastlord truly has no mercy – those who flee will soon find all paths lead to a brutal end by arrow or axe.

skillTree.name: Beastlord's Lash
skillTree.description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

skillTree.name: Hoofed Heavyweights
skillTree.description: These colossal, brutish warriors are the core of any true brayherd.

skillTree.name: Freakish Mutations
skillTree.description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.name: Call of Violence
skillTree.description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."

effects.description: Ability: "Call of Violence"

skillTree.name: Unrelenting Savagery
skillTree.description: The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Creatures of the Herd
skillTree.description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

skillTree.name: Bestial Butchers
skillTree.description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Mage Hunter
skillTree.description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

skillTree.name: Apocalyptic Vision
skillTree.description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.

effects.description: Ability: "Apocalyptic Vision"
Replaces: "Call of Violence"

skillTree.name: Gargantuan Hooves
skillTree.description: The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%

skillTree.name: Feasting Upon Man
skillTree.description: For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.

skillTree.name: Blessed by Evil
skillTree.description: Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

backgroundSkills.name: The Barren One
backgroundSkills.description: The repulsive creature known as Molokh Slugtongue is anathema to cultivated life and natural harmony. Everything Mankind does to harness nature, every act of order intended to trammel the chaos of the wild, can be undone by a single gesture from Slugtongue's blackened claw. Slugtongue is the cold talon of winter incarnate, and famine follows in his wake.

effects.description: Immortal

Raiding stance is upgraded to "Infectious raiding stance"
	(increased chance to spread plague)

A plague is spread to a nearby settlement after winning a battle.
	Small chance for a plague to break out at start of each turn.

Passive ability: "Swarm of Flies" for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "Curse of the Famine Fiend"
Spell: "Viletide"
Spell: "Stream of Corruption"

factionEffects.title: The Famine-Fiend
factionEffects.description: Stalking across the lands of Man like a black, hobbled crow, Slugtongue turns the most fecund and fertile valleys into barren and freezing wastes crawling with poisonous vermin. Everything Mankind does to harness nature, every act of order intended to trammel the chaos of the wild, can be undone by a single gesture from Slugtongue's blackened claw. Slugtongue is the cold talon of winter incarnate, and famine follows in his wake.

effects.description: Immune to Plague attrition
Enables poison attacks for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units
Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units
Plagues bolster your forces and nurture your settlements
